channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on raven mcknight

item.title: Spatial Bayesian Models of Contraceptive Deserts
item.description: Spatial data violates one of the most basic assumptions in statistics: that our observations are independent of one another. This means that many of our familiar methods – Bayesian and frequentist! – aren’t useful in modelling spatial data. In this series of blog posts, we’ll explore Bayesian methods to describe variation across space. Case study: Contracpetive Deserts Birth control is a critical aspect of basic health care.
